comment.author: 33497395@N08
comment._content: Hansa Brandenburg D I 28.48 after conversion as 20.14 prototype, about January 1917.

comment.author: 14279793@N06
comment._content: How could the pilot see where he was going ?

comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: The 28.48 number denotes it was a Phönix license-built version of the Hansa-Brandenburg D.I and built in Wien (Vienna). Camillo Castiglione owned Hansa-Brandenburg (Germany), Phönix (Austria), among others...
